evidence.title: Brandy Norwood
evidence.text: Brandy Rayana Norwood (born February 11, 1979) is an American singer, songwriter, and actress. Dubbed the "Vocal Bible", she is known for her distinctive sound, characterized by her peculiar timbre, voice-layering, and intricate riffs. Brandy is often regarded as an influential figure in contemporary R&B. Born into a musical family in McComb, Mississippi, Brandy was raised in Carson, California, where she began her career as a backing vocalist for youth music groups. After signing to Atlantic Records, she rose to prominence in the mid-1990s with her debut studio album, Brandy (1994), which spawned the US Billboard Hot 100 top-ten singles "I Wanna Be Down", "Baby", and "Brokenhearted". She became a television star with her lead role on the UPN sitcom Moesha (1996–2001) and portrayed the titular character in the television film Rodgers & Hammerstein's Cinderella (1997).
